website_summaries.verdict: This mini 3D printer arrives already assembled, and the price is low. It's great for occasional users and beginners who may upgrade in the future.
pros: Works with all types of filament
cons: Some durability issues have been reported after repeated use

customer_reviews.title: A print comparison
customer_reviews.text: Red robot = $2700 3D printer Black robot = $200 3D printer (this one) I'm stunned that you can now buy a 3D printer for $200 and get this good of a result!
customer_reviews.author: Richard S.

customer_reviews.title: Sad to have to return
customer_reviews.text: I had to send it back because the auto bed leveling never worked right. I am an expert 3d printing guy. Do it professionally. I have the V2 that works great. Would have liked a way to disable the abl so I could have taken advantage of the other features not found in the v2
customer_reviews.author: lily bug

customer_reviews.title: Frustration and disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: Frustration and disappointment. Two bad units in a row. Eagerly anticipated Christmas present to myself, unpacked, ran (6) prints fine, then died. Tried to call Monoprice customer service to work through it, but after >11⁄2 hours on hold and getting kicked off online chat 3x, I returned through Amazon. Replacement unit ran (7) prints just fine before packing it up. I would have tried a third time, but apparently that's not Amazon policy.
customer_reviews.author: William Maher

customer_reviews.title: The printer can Print with flexible filament .
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about the printer it was little ruff to get things going. The main reason i got it for is to do flexible filament and they design to do just that. I had to bring the heat down because of the all metal hot end. So far its printing really good with M3d tough 3d ink. Its to me a real good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rod37

customer_reviews.title: Great printer! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a birthday gift from my wife. I always wanted a printer but never made the jump because I didn't know anything about them. Also was not excited to learn new software. This is very easy to use and the quality of the machine and the prints are amazing! It comes with the software and a demo file to print. After using this I realize there's not much to it. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tony G

customer_reviews.title: huge disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this 3d printer, auto leveling did not work after doing a auto leveling the nozzle dug in to the bed and scratched the heated bed up badly. had it 3 days and returned it because I could finish a cat file that came with the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Todd.D

customer_reviews.title: Auto bed-leveling is a farse
customer_reviews.text: I like this printer but it is not great. Pros: -Small -Cheap -Ok Quality Cons: -Auto Bed level does not work well, after leveling to get prints to stick a manual -.50 bed level setting had to be entered. -Slow -Bed either sticks too much or does not stick at all -Recommended settings in manual for Cura did not function well
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Absolute junk. Don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk not worth the money. Returned two printers and the third is now broken. Initially purchased end of April, returned that unit within a week. Second unit lasted maybe a month. Monoprice and amazon are not helping to resolve this at all.
customer_reviews.author: dman

customer_reviews.title: Printer and Replacement Failed In Under a Week
customer_reviews.text: This printer does a reasonable job of printing out of the box. However, the original printer I ordered froze in the z-axis and stopped responding to input in about 5 days of owning it. After being replaced, the new unit now has also frozen in the same way. The second printer also intermittently fails to read the SD card (sometimes even mid-print). Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this printer due to these reliability issues. It is now an expensive paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle D Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Started Great but quickly broke. Manufacturer refused to repair/replace.
customer_reviews.text: The product started out great, but after six months it quit printing due to the thermostat not functioning. I reached out to the manufacture Monoprice, and their customer service was horrible. Took them over two weeks to get back to me and their only response was that my item was out of time for warranty repair/replacement. Worst Customer Service!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rickyb18

customer_reviews.title: After a year, some small repairs, but still going strong.
customer_reviews.text: Over a year of ownership and here is what I found: The Bed Temp wires will break internally causing the display to read a bed temp over 300C. Fan bearings are starting to go out...after about 3KG of material run through it...not surprised. The initial print bed material eventually failed and left a mess. I replaced it with a PEI sheet and back in business. But these issues are nothing that a maker or electronics hobbyist can't fix (if outside warranty) in a few moments of time. Easy to use: Yes. Great for Beginners: Yes. Would I recommend this to others? Absolutely!
customer_reviews.author: That One Guy Over There

customer_reviews.title: Skip This Printer
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for several months now. While it initially performed well with PLA, it now cannot print, period. I've replaced the hot end piecemeal—the nozzle and throat individually, and aluminum blocks with different insets for the thermocouple and the coil—and it still cannot push filament for a print. In addition to that, the accessibility of this printer is poor, as noted by other reviewers. Takeaway: $200 will get you a few months of PLA. Look forward to a new paperweight after that.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: The product support is non existent and tools not functional
customer_reviews.text: First let me start. The printer hardware is nice but the display software is very limited. To connect it to wifi it requires a phone app. Unfortunately the iOS app is no longer available. I had to bring my android phone out of mothballs to get it to connect. When I did the web interface was even more limited than the display. The printer will not link to my mac or to my PC and it kept sticking on the "Please Wait" screen for days when trying to print. I suspect they are discontinuing this printer. I suggest you avoid purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Brook Hurd

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap printer until it breaks.
customer_reviews.text: I liked this printer. It wasn't high quality, but good enough for the price. Until the heated bed broke after 9 months (which is a known common issue with this model of printers) i started the RMA process with Monoprice to try to get it repaired, but after shipping it to them, they've apparently lost my printer, (despite fedex confirmation that it was delivered to them and signed for), and nobody there can tell me what happened to it. Edit: they finally sent me a replacement, which was broken on arrival. Their customer support says they cannot help me. Monoprice is competely incompetent, and I would never purchase something from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Tolbert

customer_reviews.title: Best little printer EVER!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised to find the bed leveled right out of the box. Used pla. No problems with bed adhesion. Print had great definition. Printed at .05mm . I have a big delta. This print rivaled its quality. My delta had a self leveling bed but the IIIP is much easier. It's perfect for small projects. At $200 this is a no brainier. I highly recommend this as a fun and usefully creative toy or prototyping tool.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Printed great for 8 days
customer_reviews.text: The quality of prints were great for a $200 printer until it stopped printing :( Filament feeder motor failed after 8 days of very light use. Maybe just a bad batch. I'll give it another shot but replacement won't be coming until between May 19 to June 15th as estimated by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the newer sub $200 3D printers that have been coming out over the past few years. This is smaller than the others, but you can just take it out of the box and start printing, no assembly required. As with any of these printers, there are certain spare parts and upgrades you want to make as soon as you get it. Such as a replacement extruder housing since the printer can't print anything if that breaks. Mine also has a 40mm fan upgrade + blow ring and a rectangular cover for the annoyingly bright LCD. I really wish you could dim the LCD and LED behind the knob but you can't.
customer_reviews.author: Jason G.

customer_reviews.title: Does not deserve a good review
customer_reviews.text: I gave these guys a shot 3 times and returned every single one. I have no idea how they have a 4 star review. For the 1st printer they sent me the version 1 printer not version 2. For the second printer the build plate would not heat up and the software would glitch. For the 3rd and final printer I thought everything was working okay as I was able to do 1 complete print finally, but that was short lived. The plastic somehow got stuck in the extruder and would no longer extrude. I'm assuming it clogged but I wasn't going to mess with it. I am going to stay far away from this brand in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Luke H.

customer_reviews.title: Good features for the price
customer_reviews.text: This was my first 3D printer and I still use it. I did have to fix the bed wiring (a well known issue) after almost a year, but otherwise it's been great. It has a relatively small work surface compared to other models, but I haven't had problem with it. It has built in Wifi which isn't available on most other models in the same price range. The UI is a bit twitchy, but otherwise recommended. And their support has been good. I had a setup issue and the later problem with the bed wiring and in both cases, they were prompt with their responses.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Rumble

customer_reviews.title: A good unit for an experienced beginner.
customer_reviews.text: For what I paid, this is a great unit. That being said, I had experience with other units that helped me deal with issues that were not explained in the limited documentation. I would call this an "experienced starter" unit (for the truly broke). The selector knob is annoying and I can't get it to reliably print anything but PLA, but I have gotten some very nice prints out of it. I like big, long prints, so I often set this up to run over night or while I am work and it does very well.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level if everything works
customer_reviews.text: This is a great entry level 3D printer when it works. The first printer I received printed great, but the auto bed level didn’t seem to function so I returned the unit via RMA. The next unit seemed to work great at first but after my first overnight print the z axis sensor failed. I am currently waiting to receive the 3rd printer.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Get an Ender 3 instead
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed in the Pro. After ignoring countless Facebook posts about this printer, I bought it anyways. After just over a month and some pretty decent prints, the auto-level sensor failed just as forwarned on facebook. This issue is INEVITABLE! It's disgusting this feature made it to market but not not surprising given the reputation Monoprice has outside of 3D printers. The V2 I have has been doing fine, so much so I wanted a other but got tempted by the pro instead. There is a work around this issue a user posted on Facebook. So with any luck I'll be able to get this printer back running again.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Dombrowski

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for $200
customer_reviews.text: Never used a 3D printer before in my life. Within hours of opening the box I had the printed cat who's geometry is included with the printer. After a little more experimenting I was able to print a fidget spinner that I downloaded off of thingiverse. Looking forward to loads of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, works great
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't wait for a delta... got this instead. Works perfectly, with one exception in that the print head fan after about one print started making a grinding bearing sound, so I'll probably have to replace that. But I just tap it and it quiets down, so for now, it's working fine. The software is CURA, I just downloaded and installed the most recent version, and got it tweaked the way I like it. There's a review here on amazon that gives you a list of steps to take when you get this, like lowering the build plate, etc. Follow that persons advice. It didn't take me long to rip off the stock masking tape and use BuildTak.
customer_reviews.author: Divermartin

customer_reviews.title: Two broke within 6 months - they are very fragile
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these for my son at Christmas and it broke within a month, the print bed no longer heated. I was impressed that Amazon sent me a new one free of charge and but now that one has broken 3 months later. The one/off switch is broken. I don't even understand how that is possible on something that just sits on a table. The print quality is good and a very good beginner printer but if it is going to be so fragile, I cannot recommend it and I would not recommend this brand. I will look for a replacement from another company.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Zaug

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time trying to decide between this printer and the Ender 3. Finally, the $50 price difference and the fact that I didn't want to assemble it myself were the deciding factors. I have been posting pictures of the prints I am able to get out of this thing and my long time 3d printing friends are amazed at the detail! The nozzle did get clogged on day 2, but using youtube videos it was easily repairable. I am loving this tiny machine!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Serious Value - Just Buy It
customer_reviews.text: I have worked with consumer grade 3D printers for years using Lulzbot, Afinia, MakerBot machines. I had many doubts and reservations when I finally decided to purchase this printer. Upon opening the box I was surprised by how nice and sturdy it felt. I couldn't believe how well it did without any kind of calibration when printing the example file included on the microSD card. It will be three weeks tomorrow and aside from playing with the nozzle temp settings for my filament I've had rock solid prints every time. I've been usingthus far and the only upgrade I'd recommend for everyone is to print a new knob, there are plenty of designs on Thingiverse.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Bowen

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This was a little difficult but it was more of a learning curve like with anything you try out for the first time. The sample filament is literally a sample amount so if you wanna print lots of stuff buy some more with this. I found the instructions on how to use it fairly simple and direct. I think its a good 3D printer for a beginner. Just take your time and be patient to learn all the features and its a great little printer. It has its limits because its small but still big enough to do lots of cool stuff.
customer_reviews.author: TheBingDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Monoprice select mini v2
customer_reviews.text: Been printing since I got it no problems had to learn Cura once I figured that out no problems whatsoever mechanically will not connect to Wi-Fi and will not read large-capacity mini SD cards which is a real hassle this is 2018 and this machine will not connect to Wi-Fi that's a little ridiculous ***Update**** This thing is awesome I've been printing 12 to 16 hours prints consistently on this machine no problems at all, well some user error problems can't hold against the machine or company I'm upping to 5 stars. Going to continue printing see how it does.
customer_reviews.author: shotgun_fetus

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations... Kudos all around.
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box functionality. Super fast delivery (a day earlier than the earliest estimate). Excellent print quality. I printed an item I printed off on a Cubex Trio. This machine made it a lot thinner (less filament, faster print time). And I didn't have to spend a lot of time setting up and configuring the machine. This machine will serve me well as I learn this new toy; and I'll get it to print its own upgrades as I need them. I highly recommend this machine to beginners. At this price, I may buy one for my sweetie, too. Maybe she'll set up a jewelry business with it... If I could, I'd give this a sixth star.
customer_reviews.author: Argiod Silvertongue

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This product does print but is only good for items that are very small (less than 1/4 of the bed size). The bed was warped out of the box and the installed build tack came off after the first print. Every print that I tried that utilized anything over 1/2 the bed (specifically the right side) z-hop was introduced and the print either failed or looked horrible I will be returning this printer as I feel it is not worth the money especially since there are printers larger with a better reputation for about the same price
customer_reviews.author: PizzaTheHutt

customer_reviews.title: The best first 3-D printer to own!
customer_reviews.text: I am a mechanical engineering student and for my sophomore year I got this for myself. After couple of articles and youtube videos I was able to make couple of modifications. I got a new glass bed, printed an internal stopper and updated software for it. It was able to print everything I wanted, so smoothly and nice. After a year it broke down. The extruder needs to be replaced and I'm out of time but definitely keeping this guy for longer and thing to upgrade to extruder to the next level so I can use more complex types of plastic instead.
customer_reviews.author: Momo

customer_reviews.title: Rare quality control problem with good machine.
customer_reviews.text: I've read a lot of great reviews for this printer. Sadly mine arrived with a warped bed/build plate. Aside from the warped bed, the printer is made of quality materials and appears very well designed and assembled. I'm returning this one for a refund. If I had more time to invest in this machine I'd exchange it for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Steve G

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to engage with the online community about getting the best use out of it
customer_reviews.text: Works very well most of the time and it's basically plug-and-play! For hobbyist 3D printers, this is the right choice. It's not LOUD but you probably want to keep it set up in another room. Be sure to engage with the online community about getting the best use out of it. It's true what they say that the first thing you want to do with it is to print an adaptor and get a better nozzle because it jams. So it's not perfect, but it's right for what we want to use it for - making little toys and game pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C

customer_reviews.title: It's so much fun-- I can't wait to print everything!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought because I've been wanting one for ages and for $200, well seriously what is there to lose? So far I'm very happy. Print resolution is amazing and I know there's ways to get it even better by upgrading nozzle, etc. Downgraded to 4 stars because the unit came with some filament stuck in the feed tube that wouldn't push through. I had to take the unit apart before I used it for the first time, which seriously dampened my Christmas excitement :( However, it's printing fine and the kids just love watching the creations getting built layers at a time. So cool...
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Schwartzkopf

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer support from monoprice, lack of info available online and lack of repair options! be warned!
customer_reviews.text: this is my second monoprice select mini printer. my first one broke randomly stopped heating up the bed and nozzle. There wasnt any info online really especially for my issue, so be aware. Also monoprice refused to repair my first printer because it was past warranty. I even offered to pay for the repair service and they said they do not do repairs under any circumstances. Be aware that if you get this and it breaks you will not find anyone to fix it for you, so learn electronics! besides that the print quality is pretty decent actually for a cheap printer, just expect to replace it at minimum every year.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Not giving up yet...even a simple manual would help
customer_reviews.text: At this point I have not given up but I have been having problems...the micro card does not click into the machine and I have to rig it to stay in....because of that I have been trying the USB connector. But I am battling the USB cord as to whether it does not work or whether the attachment on the printer does not work..... keep getting a reading that there is no printer connected. I think an informational booklet or directions would be a good idea to include with the printer as most of my information has either come from you too, the Internet, or my own exploration.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I want to get a "starter" printer to see how, or if it would be possible to 3D print fractals. My first printer came from China, had some problems where language was a significant barrier. When I got the Monoprice Mini I has ran into some problems. The difference was customer service. A couple phone calls I had new printer and a technical contact at the service. Bottom line is service. And yes the Monoprice Mini can print fractals. I have delivered several samples to the gallery where my art is located.
customer_reviews.author: David Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Ive seen good reviews before but in this case
customer_reviews.text: Ive seen good reviews before but in this case, it was a pain in the ass. Didn't think that when I canceled a print, it would get pissed off and try to commit suicide by heating to 300 degrees and pretty much drilling into the floor board while simultaneously trying to leave the limit of the board. Also, the filament started leaking out the extruder on all sides of the heating box. Ive ordered replacement parts, ill have to replace the heating element since the wire broke from the ceramic filling, and the heat shield since filament caked on the original and was torn off the box.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer! Even better support
customer_reviews.text: Okay guys this is my first 3D Printer so i was not Familiar on how to use it... When i opened it up and powered it on it was a lot easier that i thought it would be to navigate and level! i did have to Call the Monoprice tech Support line to get started, i spoke with a tech for less than 20mins and now i feel like a Pro with my Mini Pro! ahaha Great printer monoprice i will be sure to go to you when i upgrade to something a little bigger
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Printer suffered from the dreaded heated bed failure early
customer_reviews.text: I sent it in for warranty repair and it took about 6 weeks to get it back. The problem happened again. I have not fixed it yet. I purchased a glass printing bed and I'm using glue sticks until I get around to fixing. Someone out there does sell a replacement heating/themistor module that plugs in, but I'm just going to solder in longer wires and drill holes for different routing. If you do a search you will find lots of people who have this same problem. Plenty of 'fix' videos on YouTube. It's a pretty good printer otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: pdm

customer_reviews.title: We did and the first one we got was awesome. Have had it ever since
customer_reviews.text: Problem after problem after problem. After 3 Amazon wouldn’t return anymore. The first time it was off balance, the second one would not read any memory card, the third worked ok at first but after 2 prints stopped reading sd cards. Just order from Monoprice directly. We did and the first one we got was awesome. Have had it ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Angelique Cogar

customer_reviews.title: Best RTR 3D printer
customer_reviews.text: To my suprise this little printer worked right out of the box. This was my first print and my first CAD drawing. Cura slicer that came with the printer worked perfectly. I am delighted with this Monoprice Select V2 printer. There was enough PLA material supplied to make about 4 or 5 of these. I am 77 and was not sure I could do this, but it was easier than I ever imagined. I highly recommend this printer. Can hardly wait for tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: SCRIBNER

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner Printer
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to use and setup. Out of the box, the machine just needs to have the bed leveled, then it prints great. I use it for printing wargaming terrain. I have been printing with it for months and the only issues I have had were things like I hadn't leveled the bed properly, or waited until it was properly pre-heated. Otherwise, its just worked, turning out print after print and no issues. I am considering buying a second one with a slightly larger bed for 28mm scale wargaming.
customer_reviews.author: William J Burn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent... ready to print just out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The autoleveling function works like a charm. Just set the correct parameters in your slicing software and the prints come out all right everytime. I definetely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Pablo Maggi Medina

customer_reviews.title: Good first printer
customer_reviews.text: This is my first 3D printer, it's a pretty good printer for $200. I'm printing the cat that comes on the SD card and it's nearly complete, I haven't had any issues so far. The included test filament looks like it'll finish this print without issue. I read some forums and watched several videos about this printer before purchasing, and it looks like it'll live up to the other reviews I saw. I'll be making all the recommended mods like the bed heater wiring and the Z axis stabilizers. For a first machine, this is worth it; I am happy I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jack of all trades

customer_reviews.title: Exceedingly poor build quality and support.
customer_reviews.text: The bed temperature sensor stopped working the day after the return period expired (sensor registered a temperature of zero whenever the print head moves to the lower left corner). I contacted Amazon who directed me to Monoprice's support team. I sent my printer in for repairs (covered under the 1 year warranty). Once returned (two weeks later), my sensor is working again, but the bed doesn't heat up at all. The sensor just fluctuates between 21 and 24 degrees (ambient temperature). Desperately wishing that I could return this and buy a different printer instead. It was great while it worked, but it didn't last very long and the support has been awful.
customer_reviews.author: Loki

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small printer to print the smaller items while my other printer was busy.....disappointing to say the least. This newer model has a "self-leveling" printing bed that FAILS miserably and with no way of leveling it mechanically , it is a fail. By the time you adjust the height of the bed to print on the right side, the nozzle gouges the left of the print surface. I think the design has some potential , but with this hardware/software combination it will do nothing but disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: CRM

customer_reviews.title: Came Broken and missing parts MONOPRICE PLEASE READ THIS
customer_reviews.text: I started my first ever print and I was so excited. Everything was going fine but then the filament stopped coming out, I search up videos and it said get unclogging filament. I did and the blue tab you're supposed to push down wasn't going down. I couldn't unclog it and now I can't print anything at all. Mine also came with a broken micro USB slot came broken, also mine shipped without a micro sd card. I wouldve reterned it but by the time I did it was about 3 months later. If you see this monoprice please contact me- theboombomb8456@gmail.com
customer_reviews.author: Haney

customer_reviews.title: Warning this can be addictive
customer_reviews.text: After leveling the table I printed the cat file to get familiar with how it works. It worked flawlessly out of the box and is very easy to use. I have stated building my own scale 3d models for my nephews model train table and so far so good. But now I am looking to up grade to a bigger printer already and looking at bigger projects so if you interested in 3D printing this is a good beginner unit but as the title says this hobby can get addictive pretty quick
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: The best Small 3d printer Period
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Mono Price Mini but my first pro. The added features have literally made this in my mind one of teh greatest printers on the market. Yes the build platform is a bit small but the quality of this machine cannot be bet. If you are looking to start 3d printing this is the machine for you. Open the box, plug it in, run the self-leveler and start printing. It's that easy. Also, I can easily run TPU on these machines as well. Total workhorse and you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: PepePrawns

customer_reviews.title: Great for Starting out!
customer_reviews.text: Never used a 3D printer before and I picked the perfect system to start with. Plenty of support online for questions and parts to print, this printing deck is large enough for some great projects. The print quality can be changed in a print slicer, for either making more refined prints or speeding up the prices with a lower quality print. I have printed everything from Baseball hat hanger to upgraded parts for the machine itself, and I haven't had to design any of it myself. Buy this machine, you will be very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore Nanko

customer_reviews.title: Okay printer, but choose the model without the touch screen
customer_reviews.text: The touchscreen broke within days of owning my first one. I believe it was a software issue as it only worked for a few seconds upon each startup. Luckily, Amazon replaced the item and sent me a new one. I've had the new one for a couple months, and I've had no issues yet. But I'd avoid the touchscreen anyway. As others have stated, build adhesion is pretty bad. I found that printing items with rifts and using a glue sticks makes some prints stick.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3D printer redemption!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this printer! i had a bad experience with another mini printer brand and i swear i was not going to get another but i was recommended this one by a friend and OMG! i do not regret giving it another try! it is simple to set up and super easy to use! i honestly love this printer! The size is so perfect! it doesn't take alot of space! i highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Ceja

customer_reviews.title: Amazing printer and a great first 3D printer
customer_reviews.text: Amazing printer and a great first 3D printer. Very open-source minded and easy to modify (recommend getting a glass bed for it) though it can get a little frustrating at times. On mine the original bed was warped a little and had to be adjusted often until I added a 6mm Borosilicate glass surface. Haven't had to re-level since after about 40 or 50 prints. Works great with OctoPrint via USB or through local SD cards, haven't needed to use wifi yet. Amazing kit for the low price! Works great with 3D Solutech filament.
customer_reviews.author: Cabe B.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with my 3D Printer purchase!
customer_reviews.text: First off, I found the following review to be very helpful:  That being said, I'm brand new to 3D printing and this is my first printer. I bought this because I was anxious to play and the PRUSA i3 MK3 I ordered before this printer would not ship for another 6 weeks. I am very impressed with this little machine and have been running it for 5-10 hours every day since receiving it. I am thrilled to be learning a new hobby and this printer has not let me down and has a strong online following for support. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent starter printer for adults or kids
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for years. It was my 1st 3d printer. The printer is good for kids or beginners. The print quality is very good, but the build area is small. This does have the advantage of saving on materials. The unit has a small footprint, which is great for the end of a desktop and at the same time it is a asthetically pleasing. Most other affordable 3d printers need a lot of room and are a bit of an eyesore.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H.

customer_reviews.title: Great prints, Doesn't last long at all.
customer_reviews.text: So before I start this review, I would like to make it known that I have years of 3D printing background behind me. I got this printer in, and it's a great price for what it is. I haven't done a lot of prints on it but the ones that I have done were exceptional comparative to other printers. The tape insulation around the head peeled off after the first print and now I can't get filament to go into the head at all. Heats up but won't do anything. Very disappointed in how short of a life it had. However, I am going to give tech support a try and will update my review!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Z.

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else! Heat-bed no longer warms up!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE, 2018-04-24: Three months after receiving this and having used it for maybe 1/3 of that time, the heat-bed will no longer warm up. This is just not right, Monoprice! Reliable printer and great printing out-of-the-box! Have this and the Tevo Tornado. The Monoprice Select Mini is my favorite. Consistent prints. No issues. All out of the box! Been printing almost non-stop since I got it a month ago. Old Faithful. It's so easy to use. My 10-year old loves it! I bought it as a backup but she thinks it's her 3D printer,
customer_reviews.author: FrankL

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I just got this today and my first 3d print came out amazing. Very simple to follow setup instructions allowed me to be up and printing in about 15 minutes (I took extra time to calibrate the printer). This is a very well built, solid unit but very compact as well. Highly recommended.. If you buy this printer, make sure you pick up some extra filament, the amount they give you in the printer isn't really enough to do more than test it out. I bought the Hatchbox PLA and it is working great.
customer_reviews.author: Philip D. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners. Fun to play around with.
customer_reviews.text: New to the 3D printer market and did a bunch of research before I decided to purchase this printer. It was super easy to set up and use. I found lots of useful sites to get designs to print and making changes to things is easy enough. I wish that it had a bigger print bed but for small things, learning, and just playing around with, this print bed is a good size for beginners. Tip: Just use the print surface that comes attached to the bed. I tried the painters tape approach and had adhesion issues. With the material on the plate I get great adhesion, actually hard to get off at times.
customer_reviews.author: MagneticNinja

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Great bang for the buck! Set up was easy. Print from SD management is a snap. And print quality is better than expected. The print bed is a bit small compared to other printers. But considering the cost, it is more than adequate. Most things I intend to print are well within capability of this machine, I am more than happy. If I have anything to print that is bigger than this machine can print, I can always split the print and epoxy the parts together. I'm very happy with this machine, especially coupled with a rasberry pi running Octoprint.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kullman

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, great price, and good quality prints
customer_reviews.text: Excellent printer for the price! Great for those new to 3D printing but don't want to make a huge investment. I knew nothing about 3D printing when I initially purchased it, but have learned a lot pretty quickly. For the price, you'd expect a few cut corners here and there, but this thing is solid. Now, I understand that weight isn't indicative of quality (looking at you, Beats by Dre), but this printer has a satisfying heaviness to it. It feels sturdy as hell. Again, I definitely recommend this to those new to the craft and those who don't have $500 to spend on a new hobby.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Middleton

customer_reviews.title: Best 3D Printer Under $800
customer_reviews.text: Amazing printer for the price. I have printed around 62 total hours on it and have had no issues. This printer works great with Cura files created in AutoCAD and SketchUp. I have been using PLA from Hatchbox and also a Signstek glass printing plate, I did not however add the glass plate due to any issues with the metal surface the unit comes with. Although this printer can't print extremely large objects it is a great platform to learn the ins and outs of printing before making a big investment. literally my only issue is that after a couple weeks the gears started to make noise but a reapplication of grease solved the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Aw, snap!  Z-axis failed on second print!
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, I can't recommend this printer and I returned it. The Z-axis broke (came completely loose during homing) the second time I printed with it. This is unfortunate because my first print out of the box was really quite good. I'm a big DIY kind of person and have been 3D printing for 1 1/2 years now. I'm not afraid to jump in and try to fix things myself but why would I waste my time fixing something that's brand new? Sorry Monoprice - I want to like your stuff but what the heck?
customer_reviews.author: McNally

customer_reviews.title: Give it time
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Took me a minute to figure out how to get the pla I was using to stick. But I think I got it down. Been running non stop for 2 days at this point. update 2 weeks later. Piss-poor customer service. My bed will not stay level after one print it needs releveled. The limit switch only works half the time. I emailed Monoprice several times with no reply other than we need more info. But I could never talk to anyone. very good printer when it works right. I did return for another one with amazon maybe I just got a bad one. I will let you know.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, not very hard to use.
customer_reviews.text: This worked almost right out of the box. I leveled the bed per the instructions and have printed several things with it. The only thing I didn't get working was the ability to print directly from my computer - the driver installation is a bit difficult. I will try installing Octupi on my Raspberry Pi and try to use that as the connection in the future. I also did have to change the heat settings when printing with yellow PLA, which is either because the material is slightly different, or I was printing some very wide (100mm long) things.
customer_reviews.author: relchip_rrea

customer_reviews.title: Review from a person with a doctorate in mathematics.
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. I owned an M3D (a different mini 3D printer) for two years. It worked okay, but it was slow, cheaply built, and I've come to find M3D has terrible customer service. This machine (the Monoprice) is a champ. It is built like a horse (almost entirely metal, from what I can tell), it is faster than my M3D, it comes with great customer support and, somehow, it is at least $100 cheaper than my last printer.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Will Break after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: This was our second time purchasing this item and the same thing happened. The heating plate wire broke after 5 uses. I called and they said i had two options: replace or full refund. Full refund please, then they said no because it only had a 30 day warranty and they wanted to give me a refund that was less than my purchase price. They were being very weird, first I had options then I didn’t, finally they said they would give me a full refund. But only after I said, let me see if that’s in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. C. Haro

customer_reviews.title: It’s nearly perfect right out of the box....
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t get any more simplistic than this one. I own 2 prusa i3 repraps and a tronxy XX-2 (junk) as well as this one. Set up was as easy as opening the box, plug in power, feed filament, load file to sd card, pre-heat, auto level....and start. First print came out as close to perfect as any of my other printers can do. My only issue is the WiFi connect app is not avail on iOS in the US, so still need to work that one out. Otherwise this little printer has far exceeded my expectations and won me over as an MP customer in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Brad316

customer_reviews.title: Amazing printer!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first home printer but I have been using commercial systems for some time. I also tried a Makerbot Replicator at work and was disappointed by its print quality. So I was not expecting much from this printer but it turned out to be a pleasant surprise! Dimensional stability is not as good as the commercial systems but the surface quality seems better with the right print parameters. The printer has been stable and I have not had any issues after 150 hours. The only down side is the lack of replacement parts.
customer_reviews.author: Unspecified

customer_reviews.title: Good prints but having trouble with heated bed now probly 100 hours in
customer_reviews.text: after about 12 prints the bed has been intermitten heating and i noticed that couple wires are breaking under the bed where fastened with zip strip, not enough wire was there to flex in the back and forth movement of the bed so it cut through the wire insulation and then the wire broke, but a couple patches and splices and releveled the bed and it was printing great again, used almost a roll of white fillament 1 kg I'm happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: reppdog

customer_reviews.title: Great printer out of the box, but not perfect. Has a very small build volume too.
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer for my dorm room. Coming from a CR-10s at home, I already found the print volume very, very small. As it turned out, it was too small for me. Also, After printing one PETG print, the whole Print surface came off. It ripped in the middle, so it was useless. Now, I ordered some BuildTak, which was also too small for it, I fixed that by cutting the second sheet to fit around the edge where the first sheet was too small. I'll try to sell this printer and get an Anycubic i3 instead, which is a much better Printer for the money than this.
customer_reviews.author: Fredi

customer_reviews.title: WiFi printing does not work
customer_reviews.text: The wifi printing simply does not work. They have put very little investment into the software for this aspect. To make the wifi printing work you should spend $35 on a raspberry pi B+ and $5-10 on an SD card, then install octoprint. Too bad because it's a waste of non utilized hardware in this machine. Otherwise this machine prints well for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: I HATE IT! This 3D printer worked amazing for about 6 months, but then it started messing up everywhere! The design of the extruder feeder is horrible! Not plastic comes out the hot end anymore! Then, when I thought it couldn't get worse, the thermometer for the extruder failed. Now the extruder never stops heating up! All in all, I wish I could give 0 stars! Don't waste your time and money!
customer_reviews.author: Olson Celebrations

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this printer
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this printer. Its my first printer but I did alot of research before purchasing. If you are new to 3D printing like I was than this is a great start. I noticed alot of printers are huge and wouldnt fit in my little NYC apartment. This however was perfect! Ive been printing stuff like crazy! Just a note, if you get this printer it requires a Heated bed mod to keep it lasting long. I did this mod in 20 minutes. Just make sure you look this up when you get the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Ekallas

customer_reviews.title: Got it on Friday, broken by Sunday evening.
customer_reviews.text: I received the Monoprice select 3D printer on a Friday afternoon, I unboxed it, calibrated the bed, spooled up the included filament and went to town printing! The first couple of prints were absolutely amazing. Spot on, with little to no defects. By Sunday morning, the printer started to make a horrible grinding noise and you could feel the body vibrating. A number of times on Sunday the printer would start to make the grinding noise and then shut off for a blink and then turn back on and continue printing. Maybe I just got a lemon :-(
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else until they fix their design flaws
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to try and support my daughters creativity. Would not buy again. Wifi uploads take 10 tries sometimes. SD card is prone to failure. Extruder is prone to crack. Bed wires will break due to design flaws. More time and trouble than it is worth. Will probably build an A8 in my free time.
customer_reviews.author: dk518

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I had bought the Ant Mini and I was happy with it for the week that it worked. I decided to go with something else, so with more research, and looking at the things I learned I needed from my previous experience I decided to go with the Monoprice Mini and I'm glad I did. It was incredibly easy to set up, the heated plate is tops and the speed is incredible. I am well pleased, so I bought two more. I haven't tried the support with monoprice, but I went to the website and there is a HUGE community and people seem generally willing to help others.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Very Good 3D Printer
customer_reviews.text: I like it, I was torn between three and four stars. As many users have found this printer's bed has warping issues. Mine got so bad I could not get anything to print. I installed a borosilicate glass bed which seems to have solved my problems. Other than that I really haven't had many issues. Print quality is really rather good. I've printed numerous models off ThingiVerse and compared the quality of the Select Mini to other printers and it does quite well. Build area is small 120mm cubed, so big projects are out but there's lots you can print. I would recommend this to anyone wanting to get into 3D printing.
customer_reviews.author: Keith B.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for, and it's not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Printed about once, failed immediately after. Printer was already updated out of the box and certain tape was missing where it should have been secured. Neither the build plate nor nozzle got warm enough to actually use. I knew all of these "features" would have to be addressed before purchasing this product and thought "It can't happen to me, some people are just not aware of what they're getting." Just know that all the negative reviews are that way because Monoprice has quite possibly the worst quality control possible for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BRAND NEW 3D printer had nicks, scratches and caked on blue filament - but sounds like this is normal . . .
customer_reviews.text: Arrived obviously used - not only scratched and nicked, but there was actually blue filament still caked onto the bed. It is laughable to imagine anyone would believe a product in this condition has not been previously used. Moreover, the instructions specifically and in highlighted print warn you not to remove the 'yellow tape' for the bed as it is used for set up. There wasn't even yellow tape on it, because it was removed by the previous user. I've notice several other similar complaints, so I guess I will have to assume that BRAND NEW Monoprice 3D printers are designed to feature scratches, nicks and caked on filament.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Had to Return One
customer_reviews.text: The first one we got was defective, It would not heat up. We returned it and got another one. It works great, been printing 4 days non-stop. You will need some 1.75 mm PLA filament, as it does not come with much. You may need 2 people to open it, as it comes in a box, inside a box, inside a box. Overall, a nice 3D printer. Would recommend to anyone with not much technical knowledge.
customer_reviews.author: Jane B. Smigel

customer_reviews.title: Bed heating issues
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty decent printer for the money, EXCEPT that there is a flaw in the design regarding the way the wires are run to the heating bed. I've only been using mine for a few days and now the bed will no longer come up to temp. If you google "monoprice mini select v2 bed not heating" and you will see that there is a lot of discussion about this. It's a known issue. I have contacted Monoprice support, but based on what I'm reading in other threads, I'm not holding my breath.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Hickey

customer_reviews.title: Hate it. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer for Christmas gift I bought it on November and I gave it to my son on Christmas. now in February 23, 2020 and still we haven't been able to successfully print a whole design. the proximity sensor is often a problem right now I think the sensor is broken I have to either find a replacement which apparently only 1place sells and are out of stock or try to get the machine back to when I bought it from. I bought it from amazon from this seller. I absolutely hate this printer is very frustrating I do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Efraín Rivas

customer_reviews.title: Better than the DIY prusa kits
customer_reviews.text: I had one of the DIY prusa printers that I used for 3 years but then I sold it. I went with this printer because of the price point (~$200) and it was supposed to be calibrated straight out of the box. It was calibrated! I started printing the file provided but only got half way through the print because they don't give you enough sample PLA to print the full "cat". This printer is well documented and printable upgrades are available. Of course my only gripe is the size of the usable printing area but you do get what you pay for. This little printer is a game changer.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: nice entry level printer
customer_reviews.text: nice entry level printer, Have had it for a few months now. I used the tape for the bed for a while but after experimenting with different spools of plastic I began to have trouble getting the stuff to stick to the bed at times. I recently cut some glass which has helped and no longer even use the bed heater with the glass, just some elmers paper glue. I did clog up a nozzle after experimenting with temperatures to get it to extrude properly. Spare parts can easiiy be found on amazon here. All in all a good cheap printer to get entry level into 3d printing with some nice results if you pay attention to settings etc.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Value
customer_reviews.text: I received my mini yesterday. It took about and hour to set it up to print perfectly and since then I have printed six objects so far. The quality is excellent, especially for $200. I've been totally amazed by this printer--to the point of leaving a review when I don't normally do so. I'll come back to update in a few months to comment on robustness, but my first impressions are really good. At the rate I'm printing, even if it dies in six months it would still be a great deal...
customer_reviews.author: Andrew A.

customer_reviews.title: If I could give it 6 stars, I would!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived 3 days ago. Worked out of the box. The included Cali software is amazing, as well. (We are printing off the parts for our next project, as I type this.) Easily generates 3-D models using gray-scaled 2D images / bitmaps... What a concept! = ) In addition to a roll of PLA, don't forget to order some 6" wide masking tape (to replace the per-print-required print-on surface) with any new purchase, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Nagy

customer_reviews.title: unforgiving. will FORCE you to learn about 3d printers..
customer_reviews.text: people say this is a good intro to 3d printer. I do agree but not because I think it's a solid little printer. its a good learning tool because this printer is just so unforgiving and will force the user to research problems. so that in itself is not a bad thing.. but the hotend is cheap, the build area is small, the build plate is warped, severe z banding issues, etc, etc, etc..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Short Term Review... Not Great
customer_reviews.text: I have had this thing for less than a month... started out great but started having issues with the bed temp sensor reading 400-600o (which means it thinks its up to temp and turns off the bed heater) prints started lifting and failing. I returned it and Amazon sent a replacement now this one has a stripped bed leveling screw (right out of the box) so I have to send it back as well. If I get one that lasts any length of time, I will try and update the review. As of right now, I can't recommend it...
customer_reviews.author: Immer

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied noob.
customer_reviews.text: This machine is my first step into 3D printing and I love it! I had to level the bad a little, but that took less than two minutes. I also had to update the copy of Cura that came on the sdcard since it wasn't saving STL files as gcode. once that was out of the way, I've been printing non-stop without any issues! Like others have said, I didn't get my sample filament at first. But it came a week later without me having to contact them, along with a note saying that there was batch of printers that didn't get the filament packaged and the issue was being corrected.
customer_reviews.author: Killa Chinchilla

customer_reviews.title: Dead in 48 hours. Terrible software to start with, turned dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: Poor software interface to start with. Began to experience intermittent failures after only a few prints. Stopped being able to connect to printer over USB (which was flaky in the first place), then temperature sensors and motor drivers failed and I couldn't move the axes using the front panel control. Then when I attempted to print, it crashed while preheating and left the heater on full blast. Got hot enough to start smoking before I noticed. The last one is *very* dangerous. This could have caught fire if I wasn't nearby. Absolutely requesting a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Killelea

customer_reviews.title: Try and return at first sign of issue.
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Been trying to get to work since christmas. Should have returned right away but figured i could make it work. Cooling fan stopped working right away and melted nozzle, feed hose. No parts for this brand so been modifying other brands to work. One thing after another. Thrown money, parts at this thing nonstop. Kids have lost faith in me and given up on this thing. I have a deformed looking cat for progress. Thats one expensive glob of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Jensen

customer_reviews.title: The V2 is Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I had to send my first Monoprice Mini back because it did not recognize the USB cable after about a month of use. Amazon shipped me another version of it, the V2, and it's fantastic. There's an additional fan, a different extruder, and the printer comes with a mat that sits on the print bed instead of just the bare metal. For the price, it's probably the best entry 3d printer on the market. I only gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because I had to lubricate the X, Y, and Z axes because they were grinding loudly out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little printer for the money!!!
customer_reviews.text: Well, the first one I got had an issue when I went to print via USB using the provided Cura. It overheated and melted the hotend. I returned it with no issue and got another one the next day. I tried to use the USB connection to print again, and noticed a runaway temp on the hotend again. Since then, I have been printing exclusively through the micro sd card, and have had wonderful results. These are a little quirky, but are awesome printers for the price. I haven't had a single issue since I started using the sd card for my prints.
customer_reviews.author: Jason R.

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Had less than 2 weeks. Item gave me an electric shock when touching the build plate to remove a print. Had been an excellent machine up to that point. Replacement unit received 3-1-18. Unit immediately dug a deep hole into print bed because z stop switch wasn't working. Will return for refund this time. Deplorable quality assurance.
customer_reviews.author: Elitistgecko121

customer_reviews.title: Probably not a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I sent the first one back after only a week or so, just stopped working. The second one isn't much better. It's still working but the print quality is really poor when it does print. Worse still most of the times it never finishes. Just all around a crappy printer. I also have a Monoprice Select V2 and that is a real good printer, well worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Stpehen Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: Price is very good. Small footprint
customer_reviews.text: I 'm new to 3D printing, and I was up and running in no time. Price is very good. Small footprint, but very capable. Not as noise as I thought it would be. It works flawlessly and I am really enjoying it. If you are a MAC user download cura 15.04.6 it works really nice. I highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: EY

customer_reviews.title: No warranty service is available.
customer_reviews.text: This product worked very well for about a month, then suffered multiple mechanical failures. This sort of thing happens, so I was not concerned when I contacted the manufacturer for help. I was told that the seller had to provide warranty service since I didn't buy direct from the manufacturer. The seller bluntly told me they wouldn't help and refused to replace the product. Clearly there is a failure on the part of the manufacturer to stand behind the product, but also the seller is offering a meaningless return policy and refusing to support the product they sell. Feeble. Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Archangel Gabriel

product_meta.title: Monoprice Select Mini 3D Printer v2 - White With Heated (120 x 120 x 120 mm) Build Plate, Fully Assembled + Free Sample PLA Filament And MicroSD Card Preloaded With Printable 3D Models
product_meta.description: Style:Mini V2| Color:WhiteMonoprice 15365 Select Mini 3D Printer with Heated Build Plate, Includes Micro SD Card and Sample PLA Filament. Max Power Consumption - 120 watts
feature_bullets: Support for All Filament Types: The heated build plate and wide range of extruder temperatures allow this printer to work with any type of filament, from basic filaments, such as ABS and PLA, to more advanced materials, such as conductive PLA, wood and metal composites, or dissolvable PVA.

Supported operating systems windows 7 and later, Mac OS X, Linux.Monoprice Quality Assurance/Technical Assistance: Live chat Mon through Fri 6am – 6pm PST | Phone at 877-271-2592 Mon through Fri 6am – 5pm PST.
Compact Desktop Design: Featuring a small footprint and basic, open frame design, this 3D printer is compact enough for any desk.

Ready to Print: Unlike most other low-cost 3D printers, this printer ships fully assembled and has already been calibrated at the factory. We even include sample PLA filament and a MicroSD card with preinstalled models, so you can start printing right out of the box!
Sample Filament diameter- 1.75mm, Filament size spool/sample- about 10ft. One sample print, Filament Color- natural/clear

Heated aluminum build plate nozzle cooling fan for printing all filament types. Complete kit with sample PLA filament, bed scraper, and MicroSD card with preloaded model files. Micro USB and MicroSD card connectivity. PC and Mac compatible. Compatible with Cura, Repetier, and other software
Supported Filament Types - ABS, PLA, Wood, Copper Fill, Steel Fill, Bronze Fill KINDLY REFER USER MANUAL BEFORE USE; Max Extruder Temperature: 482°F (250°C)

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
